Sequence Information.Source: amino acid substitution, invertebrate, animal-derived, natural derivative

Literature Information.Literature: Sequence analysis: APD analysis reveals this sequence is most similar (78.26%) toClavanin AR=W: 33%; G=N: 17%.  GRAVY: -2.45; M Wt: 2585.889; Mol formula: C120H170N42O22; molar extinction coeff: 33300.Activity: active against Gram+ S. aureus 930918-3 or 30371 MRSA or 28841 MRSA (MIC 2.5-5.8 ug/ml), E. faecalis CDC 21 (MIC 2.6 ug/ml), E. faecium 94-132 (MIC 0.3-0.5 ug/ml), L. monocytogenes EGD (MIC 0.4 ug/ml), Gram- E. coli ML-35p or mcr 106 or  BAS 849 (MIC 0.4-2.3 ug/ml), S. typhimurium 14028S or 7953S (MIC 1.3-1.5 ug/ml), K. pneumoniae 2270 (MIC 2.8 ug/ml), P. aeruginosa SBI-N or MR2123 or MR3007 (MIC 0.7-0.9 ug/ml).Antimicrobial robustness: its activity is less sensitive to salts than the WT till 300 mM:  NaCl-insensitive:E. coli.
Literature Information.Author: Lee IH, Cho Y, Lehrer RI. 1997
Literature Information.Title: Effects of pH and salinity on the antimicrobial properties of clavanins.
